page.title: 06THATCHAM HOUSE
page.content: Thatcham House is a listed building and a popular landmark within our D Block. It was built for the Vicar, Rev Hezekiah in 1866 and was finished in 1871. The most famous family who lived there were the Turners in 1902 and that's where Turners Drive got its name. Alexander Buller Turner and his brother Victor, both won the Victoria Cross and that's how Alexander Road and Victor Road got their names. The family moved out in 1948 and the house was unoccupied until 1951 when it was modernised and converted into three self-contained flats. Within a few years the house and grounds were acquired by Mr.Zornow who intends to restore Thatcham House and use half the building as offices for his building firm and to lease out the other half. Conversion is still taking place.
